feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued March 11 at 10:07AM AKDT until March 12 at 8:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG STORM TO IMPACT THE WESTERN ALEUTIANS AND BERING SEA... A PACIFIC SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE WESTERN ALEUTIAN CHAIN ON MONDAY AND BRING STRONG WINDS TO THE AREA. THE STRONGEST WINDS LOOK TO DEVELOP MONDAY MORNING AND SLOWLY DIMINISH MONDAY EVENING. ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING...

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 11 at 4:51AM AKDT until March 11 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WIND...NORTHWEST 15 TO 30 MPH...STRONGEST ALONG THE COAST. * WIND CHILL VALUES...30 TO 45 BELOW ZERO. * TIMING...THE LOWEST WIND CHILLS WILL OCCUR THIS MORNING...AND SLOWLY INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY. WIND SPEEDS LOOK TO DIMINISH

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 5:23AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SEVERAL DAYS OF WET WEATHER AHEAD FOR THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA AND MONTEREY BAY AREA... A SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IN THE WEATHER PATTERN OVER THE EASTERN PACIFIC WILL MEAN WET WEATHER ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL CALIFORNIA FOR MUCH OF THIS WEEK AND INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. THE INITIAL FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL BRING ONLY LIGHT AMOUNTS OF RAIN TO THE SAN

entry.summary: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT... .A SERIES OF WEATHER SYSTEMS WILL MOVE THROUGH INTERIOR NORTHERN CALIFORNIA BRINGING PERIODS OF PRECIPITATION TODAY THROUGH NEXT WEEK. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 4:09AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN AND SNOW IN THE NORTHERN SIERRA THIS WEEK... LOW PRESSURE OVER THE EASTERN PACIFIC WILL DIRECT ABUNDANT MOISTURE INTO THE SIERRA TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL BRING SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION TO THE NORTHERN SIERRA AND NORTHEAST CALIFORNIA. THE HIGHEST AMOUNTS WILL OCCUR ALONG AND WEST OF HIGHWAY 89 FROM THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN NORTH TO LASSEN COUNTY.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 7:32AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: A DRY AIR MASS WILL COMBINE WITH GUSTY SOUTHWEST WINDS THIS AFTERNOON TO CREATE CONDITIONS MORE CONDUCIVE FOR THE SPREAD OF WILDFIRE. RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES SHOULD DECREASE TO AROUND 30 PERCENT BY AFTERNOON...WITH OCCASIONAL GUSTS TO AROUND 25 MPH. STAY TUNED TO NOAA ALL HAZARDS WEATHER RADIO OR VISIT OUR WEB
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Fairfield; Northern Middlesex; Northern New Haven; Northern New London; Southern Fairfield

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 11:44AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ENHANCED THREAT FOR THE SPREAD OF WILDFIRES THIS AFTERNOON... SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL AVERAGE AROUND 10 MPH WITH FREQUENT GUSTS OF 15 TO 20 MPH THIS AFTERNOON. THE RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL DROP TO BETWEEN 20 AND 30 PERCENT. FUEL MOISTURE REMAINS QUITE LOW EAST OF THE ALLEGHENY FRONT DUE TO THE RECENT DRY WEATHER. THE COMBINATION OF GUSTY WINDS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND LOW FUEL

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 11:06AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ENHANCED FIRE THREAT THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING... RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL BE DECREASING THIS AFTERNOON AND FALL TO THE UPPER 20S TO AROUND 30 PERCENT DURING AFTERNOON. ADDITIONALLY, WINDS WILL INCREASE AND BE GUSTING BETWEEN 15 AND 20 MPH. THE COMBINATION OF LOW HUMIDITIES AND GUSTY WINDS WILL ENHANCE THE FIRE THREAT DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Delaware Beaches; Inland Sussex; Kent; New Castle

entry.summary: ...ENHANCED THREAT FOR THE SPREAD OF WILDFIRES THIS AFTERNOON... SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL AVERAGE AROUND 10 MPH WITH FREQUENT GUSTS OF 15 TO 20 MPH THIS AFTERNOON. THE RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL DROP TO BETWEEN 20 AND 30 PERCENT. FUEL MOISTURE REMAINS QUITE LOW EAST OF THE ALLEGHENY FRONT DUE TO THE RECENT DRY WEATHER. THE COMBINATION OF GUSTY WINDS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND LOW FUEL

entry.summary: ...ENHANCED FIRE THREAT THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING... RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL BE DECREASING THIS AFTERNOON AND FALL TO THE UPPER 20S TO AROUND 30 PERCENT DURING AFTERNOON. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 4:09AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN AND SNOW IN THE NORTHERN SIERRA THIS WEEK... LOW PRESSURE OVER THE EASTERN PACIFIC WILL DIRECT ABUNDANT MOISTURE INTO THE SIERRA TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL BRING SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION TO THE NORTHERN SIERRA AND NORTHEAST CALIFORNIA. THE HIGHEST AMOUNTS WILL OCCUR ALONG AND WEST OF HIGHWAY 89 FROM THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN NORTH TO LASSEN COUNTY.

entry.summary: ...FLOOD POTENTIAL OUTLOOK FOR QUICK RISES ON RIVERS AND STREAMS IN THE FOLLOWING COUNTIES IN OREGON...COOS...CURRY... .A SERIES OF WET STORM SYSTEMS BEGINNING EARLY NEXT WEEK WILL BRING PERIODS OF STRONG WINDS AND ALSO HEAVY RAINFALL TO THE COAST AND COASTAL RANGES. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 11:44AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ENHANCED THREAT FOR THE SPREAD OF WILDFIRES THIS AFTERNOON... SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL AVERAGE AROUND 10 MPH WITH FREQUENT GUSTS OF 15 TO 20 MPH THIS AFTERNOON. THE RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL DROP TO BETWEEN 20 AND 30 PERCENT. FUEL MOISTURE REMAINS QUITE LOW EAST OF THE ALLEGHENY FRONT DUE TO THE RECENT DRY WEATHER. THE COMBINATION OF GUSTY WINDS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND LOW FUEL

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 11 at 9:47AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WARM WEATHER WILL CAUSE ICE ON STREAMS AND RIVERS TO BEGIN MOVING... TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S TO LOW 70S WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN RUNOFF ON STREAMS AND RIVERS ACROSS THE REGION OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. THIS WILL CAUSE ICE TO BEGIN BREAKING UP AND MOVING DOWNSTREAM...POTENTIALLY FORMING NEW ICE JAMS. PERSONS WITH
